column1: #Text=[0014] The suspension mechanism may include a rod having an upper end coupled with the base structure, a middle portion disposed through the bore in the support frame, and a lower end having a stop mechanism, and a support spring provided around the rod having an end connected to the stop mechanism and an opposite end connected to the support frame.
#Text=There may be one suspension mechanism coupled with each arm of the support frame.
#Text=The suspension mechanism may further include a dampening spring provided around the upper end of the rod to further absorb vibration.
#Text=The upper end of the support spring may abut a pad provided in the radial arm of the support frame.
#Text=Additionally, a spacer pad may be attached to the upper end of the rod.
#Text=[0015] The wall portions of the base structure may be shaped to match the contour of the wall portions of the tub when the tub is coupled with the base structure.

#Text=[0016] The present invention allows the base structure to remains fixed, so that the tub of the clothes washing machine can be directly attached to the base structure, and remain coupled thereto while the moving assembly of the machine vibrates during operation.
#Text=Since the tub is fixed and free of vibration and oscillation, it may be constructed so that it defines a portion of the cabinet.

#Text=As a result, this solution simplifies the construction of the clothes washing machine, allowing the cabinet to be configured in different manners and increasing the options to define different ornamental plastic forms for the clothes washing machine.

#Text=Additionally, since the suspension system only needs to maintain the support frame, the invention further allows utilization of simple suspension systems that take up a smaller amount of space within the washing machine.
#Text=[0017] The invention will be described with reference to the drawings, in which:
